newsitem.title: USA: BankBoston shares up after Q1 earnings.
newsitem.headline: BankBoston shares up after Q1 earnings.

text.p: BankBoston Corp shares rose after the company reported first-quarter earnings close to expectations and raised its dividend.
One analyst, Gerard Cassidy of Hancock Institutional Equity Services, said growth of nine percent in net interest revenue from a year ago was very strong.

Net interest revenue was $625 million for the first quarter, compared with $616 million in the prior quarter and $571 million a year ago. The net interest margin was 4.47 percent for the first quarter of 1997 and the fourth quarter of 1996, compared with 4.40 percent a year ago.

"I think the market is just really breathing a sigh of relief," said analyst Nancy Bush of Brown Brothers Harriman, referring to the rise in BankBoston's stock. She said she had been worried the net interest margin would be down five or 10 basis points but it turned out to be flat compared with the fourth quarter of 1996.
She added that savings from the acquisition of BayBanks are also starting to show up in the BankBoston results.
The company's first-quarter earnings of $1.27 per share versus $1.13 from operations a year ago matched the consensus estimate compiled by Institutional Brokers Estimate System.
BankBoston raised its quarterly dividend to $0.51 per share quarterly from the old rate of $0.44.
BankBoston shares were up three to 66-5/8 in early afternoon.
